N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 489.15 - Special needs funds

State Regulations
(a) In accordance with standards established by the department, local districts
must establish a process to periodically advance funds to operators of
certified family-type homes for adults to meet one or more of the special needs
of their residents who are receiving supplemental security income, additional

State payments or home relief. Local districts must periodically advance
payments to operators of certified family-type homes for adults for the
following special needs items: (1)
up to $290
a year per resident for clothing, transportation, recreation and cultural
activities; (2)
up to $500 a year
per home for the provision of substitute care for scheduled and emergency
absences of the operator; and
(3)
up to $75 a year per home to be used for health and safety equipment. (b) Local districts must establish
a separate account for special needs funds and must administer payments to
operators out of this account in accordance with procedures established by the
department. (c) In accordance with
the provisions of section
153
of the

Social Services Law, the department must pay local districts for 100 percent of
the cost of special needs funds pursuant to subdivision (a) of this section
from monies appropriated for such purpose. (d) The department also must provide 100
percent reimbursement to local districts for the administrative costs related
to the expenditure of special needs funds pursuant to subdivision (a) of this
section to the extent that such costs do not exceed 10 percent of the special
needs funds expended by local districts. Related administrative costs of local
districts in excess of 10 percent of the special needs funds expended by local
districts must be reimbursed by the department at a rate of 50
percent. (e) The department will
periodically make advances to local districts in anticipation of the
expenditure of special needs funds pursuant to subdivision (a) of this
section. (f) Nothing contained in
this section will be construed to require expenditures by local districts
pursuant to subdivision (a) of this section in excess of the amounts made
available to local districts by the department. (g) State payments to local districts may
only be made from and to the extent of monies appropriated to the department
for the expenditure of special needs funds pursuant to subdivision (a) of this
section. (h) The department must
periodically audit payments and the maintenance of the special needs accounts
established by local districts in accordance with the provisions of subdivision
(b) of this section. (i) The
department may prescribe forms to be utilized by local districts and
family-type home operators in the implementation of this section. Failure of an
operator to use forms prescribed by the department will result in withholding
of additional payments pursuant to the provisions of this section. (j) Social services districts must review the
expenditure of special needs funds during their inspection visits of certified
family-type homes for adults required by section
489.5
(a)(2)
of
this Part to assure that such funds are spent in accordance with the provisions
of subdivision (a) of this section. (k) The department may require local
districts to periodically submit reports on the implementation of this section
on forms to be prescribed by the department. Notes
